comment: We have a small house and didn’t need a 5.1 system for better sound.We have a TCL 55” 4K set and plugged this into the HDMI/ARC port on the TV.  This allowed the TV remote to control the volume.  The remote included with the sound bar is only used to switch between the Movie and News modes when we’re not watching something that needs to be loud.

1. Has 2 red, & a white, a green, and a a blue array of status lights.  They ware way too small and way to dim to be seen when viewing the tv.  One must walk right up to the device in a dimly lit room to really see what is going on.  The rule for lights to be noticed but not intrusive or distracting is that they must be very bright, very small, and must shine out from the bottom of a black pit, like a locomotive about to emerge from a railroad tunnel.2. The remote is way, way too small to be handy; fine for Barbie & Ken, but not for the rest of us.  Requires 2 hands to use the bottom row of buttons.  Also it gets lost on my messy coffee table. Similar in size for the remote to my outdoor security light, but that one is OK as I use it maybe once a month; this one gets used a lot in one evening; controls volume, muting, mode, on/off, etc.  Again, the rule for remotes for this duty cycle is that they be no smaller than a ROKU remote.  Also the projected beam is very, very narrow.  Barbie & Ken will need a 4 power rifle telescopic sight to aim it properly.

I purchased the Alto 7 2.0 with built in subwoofer TS7000 for my TCL - 43"  4K UHD TV model 43S525 using the HDMI ARC output connector. It was very easy to setup and program to my TCL Remote and my Cox Cable remote by enabling the CEC Control instruction in the manual. The Sound difference is major under the movie mode while watching the football game it was just like being there. I would HIGHTLY RECOMMEND buying only a TCL Alto soundbar for your TCL 4K UHD TV. I did try a non TCL brand soundbar and I had to return it due to either no sound and so difficult to set up

I own 2 TCL smart TVs and have loved them since day 1, with the weakest part of them being their built in speakers. When I saw TCL made a sound bar with wireless subwoofer, I had to try it out. So far I am loving the set. Setup and install was super fast. Just unpack and plug in via the included HDMI cord and the HDMI Arc and you are ready to rock and roll. I love that my original TCL Roku remote controls the volume on the sound bar so unless I want to switch the audio mode, no need for the included remote. I have also connected my phone via bluetooth and that worked perfectly as well. In terms of audio performance, I'm no audiophile, but this thing delivers. Our living room is a decent size and the sound and volume output is great. For the price, I am super satisfied and would recommend this to anyone looking for a simple plug and play sound bar to upgrade their stock tv speakers. Is this a Bose surround sound system, no, but does it sound great and provide good quality for an amazing price, heck yeah!!

I Purchased the TCL Alto 7 without the separate subwoofer. I have this connected through HDMI ARC on my TCL Roku TV. I knew that because this only had a built-in subwoofer, lows weren't going to be amazing, but that's not my complaint. For the first time for any speaker I've purchased, the highs are basically non-existent. It's like this sound bar can only produce mids. Vocals sound muffled and overall sound is comparable to some built-in TV speakers. Yes, this is an upgrade over my TCL TV speakers, but you could get better highs out of $10 speakers. This soundbar is absolutely not worth $80.I've tried the 3 different equalizer presets and I don't hear much of a difference.

We had to move our stereo that the TV was hooked up to so I got this sound bar. Its mounted on the wall under the TV so I didn't want a wired sub-woofer. The Sub-woofer sits under a chair. While its not a booming surround sound it gives a much richer sound then the TV but itself and has some nice bass that you won't get from just a soundbar. Plus I like that it goes to sleep then automatically turns on when sound goes into it.

I had a professional installer with 29 yrs of experience try to set this up for me. What should have been a 20 minute job to mount and install ended up taking him 45 -60 minutes and he still could not get it to work with the TCL TV I have.  TCL customer service is an absolute joke. They are difficult to understand and they repeat themselves over and over. The installer packed it back in the box for me and I plan to return ASAP

I bought this soundbar to use with a TCL 43S425 TV. It does block the TV's remote sensor, but comes with an IR passthrough cable so that is a non-issue. The soundbar works well enough as all I really wanted was front-facing sound. My father uses the TV and is starting to have hearing issues so I wanted the sound playing toward him to prevent him from turning the volume up on the rear-facing TV speakers all the time.The only thing I couldn't figure out is if the soundbar could be used with bluetooth headphones. The instructions are not very clear on bluetooth functionality. It seems the only way to connect via bluetooth (other than the wireless subwoofer which connects automatically) is by connecting from another device like a smartphone. I don't know how well or if it would work at all to connect both the soundbar and wireless headphones via bluetooth as I just don't want to get into anything that complicated.

This unit does not seem to cooperate with our Sony smart TV using the HDMI ARC connection. It will play sound after a series of turning on and off to convince the TV it is connected and on, but every time the TV is turned off and we come back to it, we have to go through the same routine of turning on and off multiple times to get the TV to switch from internal to external speaker mode. We will attempt another connection method to see it it resolves the issue, but wasn’t necessary with our last, Vizio unit connected in the same way (soundbar issue, not a TV issue).

Bought one of these only a few months ago. From the beginning, I would sometimes inexplicably have issues with playing music from my iPad via Bluetooth. Sometimes the music would be horribly garbled. There was no apparent rhyme or reason—putting the iPad right next to it didn’t help.Things went downhill from there. Every so often, the subwoofer would get out of sync and create an echo. I would have to unplug and plug back in to fix, sometimes multiple times.

If you have this soundbar connected to a TCL Roku TV, go the the TCL website and download the software update, which you can install via USB on the soundbar.  This will make the Roku TV remote's mute button functional (mine didn't work until I installed the update).  It will also give you the ability to enable/disable the soundbar's auto standby feature.  Be sure to select the correct update for your particular soundbar.  My piddly complaints would be that the soundbar remote is small, feels flimsy, and is easy to misplace.  It would also be nice to see the volume level onscreen.  But most of all, an auto sound leveling feature would be nice since commercials tend to blast in at a higher sound level.  Other than that, it's a very good soundbar with a rich bass response and clear sound. Use the three buttons on the bottom of the remote to change the bass level.

I bought this soundbar as a gift for my father however I am seriously considering getting another soundbar for him as the great quality of the sound didn’t break my bank. The soundbar came with all of the accessories needed for installation including the wall mount. The design is sleek black and modern and is low enough to not block my TVs IR reader but even if it did, this soundbar has an IR passthrough allowing you to access your tv THROUGH the bar! I am very happy with this bar and will definitely be back!

I've only had these speakers for 24 hours so this is an early impression. I plugged the soundbar into my TCL Roku TV using the provided optical cable, powered bothsoundbar and subwoofer, and it worked. Someone commented the volume on the Alto 7 could not be controlled if you used the optical cable, but I can assure you, you can. I paired with my phone and played music for hours today as well.

Love this sound bar the 7.1+ Alto 2.1Sound is great for us 60+er’s that like good sound without the need to blow out the windows and doors. The sub woofer blue tooth's nicely to the sound bar. The sound bar is wired by HDMI to the tv and has its own 110v power supply. It has an IR cord too which I guess is for your sound bar remote, and an optical cord as well which I haven’t a clue what it’s for so I didn’t install it. I mounted it below the tv so I’ve got 3 wires/ cables showing slightly between tv and sound bar. If you mount it above your tv you can conceal them better. The TCL tv recognizes the sound bar and is easy to make them work together. The remote has music mode, movie mode and news mode which is fabulous! Highly recommend! This unit is a must to really enjoy your big tv!
The sound is flat. The TV speakers sound better. Wish I had not bought this.

Nice soundbar with thumping bass from the subwoofer. It has plenty of volume and power for our use. The sound is full-bodied but would like to have a bit crisper higher sound to make voices easier to understand. The remote is pretty flimsy and small. I am concerned it will get broken or lost easily. Thankfully, the remote for the TCL Roku TV works for the volume of the soundbar and I can keep the soundbar remote on the sideline. The Toslink cable didn't want to fit into a splitter so I had to use a different cable to connect the splitter that came from the TV. Pairs easily with Bluetooth devices, but keeping the remote stowed away means manual switching at the soundbar. Would be nice to have the soundbar work off of third party remotes. While the Roku TV remote can control the sound for the TV and soundbar, third party remotes can only be programmed for the TV and don't work with the soundbar. Oh well.

I reviewed several different TV soundbars that ranged from $100 to $1,500 and based on all those reviews, I was swayed to the TCL Alto 7 in part because I have a TCL Roku TV and others said the integration was seamless and in part because TCL emailed me a 15% discount coupon for the Alto series 5/7 which just clinched the deal.  The sound quality is so much better than what the 55" TCL 6 Series Roku TV has for native speakers; no surprise based on other reviews I had read.  The included remote control is rarely needed, but it has power, mute, volume controls, a source selection (and a hot-key for selecting Bluetooth input) as well as three EQ presets for music, movie, or news.  I tend to leave it on the "movie" EQ preset for everything based on a review I read on PC Magazine and confirmed by some personal experimentation.  I only use the soundbar remote to wake up the unit if it goes to standby because no sound was played for a long period (maybe 15 min or so), but the TV was on; otherwise I use the Roku TV remote for volume/mute and it works fine (my soundbar is connected vie the HDMI ARC for integrated control).  My two very minor nits are that:  a) the native TV speakers increment/decrement by 1 step when you increase/decrease volume via the TV remote and the soundbar seems to jump by 3-4, so there's less fine control over the volume; and b) the bass sub-woofer doesn't have an independent volume control.  I initially thought the sub-woofer wasn't working even though the blue LED on the back panel indicated it was--when I turned up the volume pretty high (past 35) I started to hear something out of the sub-woofer.  I understand that an earlier version of the Alto was too boomy during movies and this is likely TCL swinging too far the other way to address that complaint.  An independent sub-woofer volume control would be the ideal solution, but overall it's still a great sound quality for the price.

In an effort to make these devices more streamline, they've made them too small to add speakers of a decent size.  It talks about "full range speakers" when in effect you get a bunch of tweeters and the system relies on a passive sub-woofer to provide the bass, which is does very poorly.  The sound was tinny, not any better than the horrible speakers built into my LG TV.The pros, such as they are, were that it was extremely easy to setup, remote worked very well, the bluetooth pairing was extremely simple and instructions for setting the TV digital output were very helpful.  Volume was beyond anything you would actually need.  Maybe a true equalizer capability would have helped, versus the there presets you are given.  A powered sub would have made a difference as well, passive is just not efficient.

The product gets 4 stars. In my case there is an annoying but nowhere near fatal flaw. After lengthy usage, sometimes when the video is paused, when it resumes the audio is scratchy and awful. The fix is to turn the soundbar off and back on. Pointed this out to support but they weren't much help. It's no big deal really. Haven't heard about this phenom anywhere else.And the subwoofer, which is a nice extra, is mostly designed to get us over the fence to buy I suspect. It's not much of a subwoofer in action I'm afraid. I wouldn't count on it to rock the house. Thing is, most would probably have bought anyway, woof or not. The sound is everything you'd want in a soundbar and for the money you really can't go wrong.

I have had a number of major problems with this product, even when it is paired with a new TCL 6 series TV (65R617) which I thought would allow it to integrate smoothly.By far the most annoying problem is the 1-2 second lag between the video and audio when connected via HDMI ARC. The other inputs don't appear to work any differently, and obviously the presence of HDMI ARC and ability to control the combination with 1 remote was a major selling point. I contacted TCL who attempted to be helpful and quickly sent me a firmware upgrade/update, but these changes had no impact on the problem. If audio sync issues are bothersome to you the persistence of this problem makes the product unusable.

Just bought the 65R617 TV, and I bought this sounds bar the day it came out to go with it... I really, really wanted to love this soundbar, but it just isn't there yet. The sound continuously fluctuated during every show and movie we watched (from all sources), and it just wasn't worth the price. Constantly having to adjust the volume for no reason gets really old, really fast. Sound quality was nothing to write home about, either. Hopefully TCL can fix this.

I originally bought a Bose 5 Solo sound bar because Bose is the best right?? Think again! I got a 55in TCL Tv and originally passed over this product because I thought tv brand can’t be as good as Bose.. boy was I wrong!Long review of why this is better than Bose 5.0 for those who care to compare. For those just wanting my response to this product skip to last paragraph.

Liked it so much....I bought another one. I purchased one earlier in the year, for a TCL tv in another location. Hooks up nice with the TCL tv....I have an older (2011) Samsung 3D tv where Iam now....thought it would improve the sound here (I don't have good hearing). I find myself not watching CC with the bar. Has very good base (separate woofer). Contrary to the very few - reviews I read, it is simple to hook up. I use the digital optical cable supplied, and have had no issues. My phone's bluetooth hooks right up....I listen to Pandora through the soundbar....it sounds great....Comes with all cables needed....a remote control....manual and quick start guide (which is easy to understand)....and hardware to place the bar on a wall. I bought this one through Amazon warehouse, used....and it is as brand new! Was repackaged to the hilt....Anyway....I would recommend this to anyone....even less tech savvy people....just follow the instructions....You can do it!

I have looked at sound bars for years, and just felt like…nah…I don’t really need it, the TV sounds good enough.  I have a TCL TV and a couple Insignia TVs – and the sound is good…but there is no going back after the Alto Sound Bar.  The difference is incredible.  The sound bar arrived in a couple days from Amazon, was incredibly simple to set up, and looks great.  I was able to tuck the sound bar behind the TV, and you can’t even tell it’s there.  The subwoofer, I was surprised how great it sounds for being wireless…as good as a wired subwoofer I have in another room.  The ability to use my phone, and play music is an added bonus.  I put a TCL TV in a sunroom addition, it was not wired for cable, so the TCL Roku TV has been in there for a couple years.  But to play music…I had to turn the TV on, and use an app (or bring a small portable speaker)….now I just use the Alto Sound Bar – and it sounds great.  The subwoofer… with music…you forget how great some bass sounds.  I didn’t listen to an Alto w/o a subwoofer (saw it first at Best Buy, but was on a motorcycle and could buy it)– but if you are torn between the 2 versions…I strongly recommend the subwoofer.  It is small, tucks in next to the couch, no wire (just power cord) and makes a huge difference.  I haven’t tried it with a non-TCL TV, but the sound bar came with multiple ways to connect to TVs and should have no problem.  The bonus w/a TCL TV is you use the one TV remote and it controls the volume/power for both.  The Alto sound bar remote is small and simple.  Nice job TCL.

There are a couple ways to connect this sound bar to a TCL Roku TV.  If you use the headphones cable to connect the TCL roku tv and the sound bar, you can use the Roku TV remote to control the volume and see the volume indicator on the television. If you use the optical cable then you need to use separate remotes and you wont have a volume indicator. The  Roku Tv remote will not toggle the sound bar on or off though.Works and sounds great even with the headphone cable attached.

Read other reviews about the bar not being controlled by Roku remote and such but in my case that's untrue. I have a TCL P605 TV and have the soundbar hooked up via optical output. After hooking everything up make sure you press the appropriate output on the provided soundbar remote, in my case optical. I pushed my volume down to 0 (zero) via Roku remote and raised it to 5. Adjusted the volume via the remote provide with soundbar and raised via Roku to 10 and adjusted again. I'm sure you can skip 5 or 10 but this was my first time playing with such settings. After you've fine tuned your volume simply put the soundbar remote away and power off TV. When you power on TV again simply push the up volume on your Roku remote and the soundbar should power on. I'd wait until the LED (orange in my case) is lit before adjusting sound anymore. Also, with the P605 I had to raise the TV so the IR and visibility was better.

This review is for the 7.1 system. I waited a long time for this to become available, as I was not sure what other products would work with the quite limited Roku remote that my 65" TCL Roku TV came with. Setup was easy using the ARC HDMI port - simply plug and play. The TV was already setup to switch over when the sound bar was detected. This VASTLY improves the sound quality compared to the rather sad stock TV speakers, especially for just plain old TV or Movie watching. Volume control using the original Roku remote is almost flawless, though there has been 1 or 2 times when the Sound Bar simply has not turned on with the TV. Bluetooth works well, and the unit pairs quickly when turned on using its own remote or with a button press on the unit itself.Sound quality is Acceptable, as mentioned its vastly better then the TV itself. The sub-woofer is only a 6" unit, though it has an attractive and easily hidden cabinet, and the wireless functionally is good.

TCL products are unsurpassed in bang for buck these speaker are perfect for a small apartment or room. Good sound solid bass easy to mount integrates with a TCL TV you can use the TV remote to control the volume and turn on or off.

Be careful! TCL sells this with their 50S425 television and the combo does not work. Because of the speaker height , if you place the sound bar in front of the TV you will not be able to use the TV remote - it blocks the line of sight to the sensor on the TV. Alternatively, if you place the sound bar behind the TV you will not be able to use the sound bar remote because the TV blocks the sensor on the sound bar. Very poor combination by TCL.

Really wanted to have the Alto 7+ soundbar to complete my sound setup.  I guess I won't since the main reason was to use the remote on my 55" TCL tv to control the soundbar and with no signal coming from the HDMI ARC connection,  I am returning the unit.  Didn't have time to determine how it sounds so I'll have to pass on that.  I spent almost an hour and a half with tech support.  Exhausted every setting without getting the HDMI ARC connection to work. Disappointed.  Revised to 4 stars - would have been 5 if it had better equalization feature.  Found out it was the tv with the HDMI ARC problem.  Contacted TCL Support.  They stayed with me to troubleshoot the soundbar and offer help to resolve the tv issue.  The optic connection works great so decided to just use the included remote to control volume.  The unit was easy to setup and operate.  It has enough versatility to handle all my sound needs. Nice unit.

I bought this as a combo to go with a 50" TCL TV. Having owned a 55" for a couple of years now, I know the built in TV speakers are pretty bad, so I wanted to improve upon that.This soundbar does sound good out of the box. I would prefer the ability to do some tweaks (treble/bass/etc) but none of that is available. It's good enough for a bedroom, but nothing like the quality you'd want in a home theater.

This is my first soundbar purchase ever and overall I can say this is a great budget soundbar. The sound quality doesn't blow me away like a Bose might but the TCL is definitely and upgrade from the built in speakers in my 55in LG 4K TV. The soundbar itself is very clear providing good middle and high frequency response. I have it connected to the TV using HDMI ARC. My TV recognized this and automatically configured the output itself. My Roku remote is now able to from the Roku stick, TV power and the soundbar volume. The subwoofer has good low frequency sound quality as well but is a little quieter that I myself would of wanted but it does give that level of depth to the sound that built in the speakers lack. I have my tv hung on the wall and used some soundbar brackets from Mounting Dream to hang it from the tv which worked out great!

Really disappointed with this sound bar. Bought it to go with the 2018 TLC Roku Smart Tv... the speakers on the tv work much better than the sound bar, and it really doesn’t get very loud. The “home theater” aspect of it is an absolute joke.

A sound bar from the same manufacturer as the TV it's connected to ought to work seamlessly. That is, as if it were built into the TV. That's why I bought this one, and not one made by AwesomeKickassSpeaker Company. I should never have to periodically dig out its remote and turn the thing back on. The TV is on - the speaker is on. The TV is off - the speaker can go to standby mode. That's how it's supposed to work, and that's why I give 2 stars out of five.

I’m going to give you a review that is honest and doesn’t sound fake or over the top.BASS- The Bass is amazing fora sound bar and provides a good thump in the two modes it’s needed most (music and movie)

This soundbar is AMAZING! I already own a few TCL TVs and I love them, so I wanted to add more sound to my living room TV as we often have people over to watch football games, UFC fights etc. I'm pretty OCD about things, and wanted my soundbar to match my TV, so when I found out TCL was coming out with soundbars I was super stoked! Setup was easy and the sound is AWESOME! It really makes me feel like I am at a movie theater or sporting event! It's just what I was looking for I couldn't be happier. The price is great and you wont be disappointed!

My whole problem with this soundbar is in the headline. I have a TCL TV Serie 5 which doesn't have terrible speakers comparing with some others LED TV, but it's obviously not really good neither. Then I decided to improve a bit the sound quality to ge something with a cleaner sound for movies mostly and a bit more bass. This soundbar look good and fit just okay with my TV, either if I expected a better fit with dimension. So everything about this soundbar is decent for the price (including bluetooth  and Hdmi arc). But this is absolutely NOT an improvement  to my TV. The sound is barely better. I had to listen very carefully to realize that there is a little more clarity but just a little and in a movie it is barely noticable.I got the 7 without subwoofer so I don't expected much for the bass but this has pretty much no bass at all ! Even at this price range there is no way this worth the investment over my tv sound.

This sound bar and sub woofer set works great and is really easy to use with a Roku TV.  The sound is a big improvement over the build in Roku TV speaker.  The bass sound is good, the normal sound from the sound bar sound good as well.  My only complain with this is the power save feature.  It will time out before the TV goes out meaning you have to turn it on.  This works well if you use the remote provided with the TV.  However, if you're using one of the RF Roku remotes, it will not turn the speaker back on.  It would be nice to have a way to turn off the time out or increase the time out.  This was by no means something to make me not want the speaker, it's a great sound bar.  Just an unfortunate issue when using a different remote.  I would recommend this if using a Roku TV, unsure how well it works with other TVs.

This was super easy to set up with my TCL Roku TV.  The sound is exactly what I wanted.  My only issue is that I am not wall mounting my TV and the sound bar does not nestle nicely underneath so it block the TV sensor.  There is a sensor you plus into the soundbar & stick on he TV to fix this issue - only it hasn't really worked.  So that's been annoying.  I will continue to adjust it's placement to see if I can make it work better.

I'm not looking for some elaborate home theater setup, just an improvement to the standard flatscreen speakers. This is perfect. It adds so much depth to the audio experience that I forgot was there. I recommend this as a cost-effective way of enhancing your TV experience.The setup was an absolute breeze. I have a TCL TV, so with the ARC connection, it's essentially a plug-and-play. On that note, the only thing that is inconvenient for me is that the sound bar is slightly taller than the gap between the bottom of the TV and the shelf - i.e., the TV's legs are too short to allow the sound bar to fit snuggly under the TV, so it blocks the TV remote's sensor. Whatever, I'll use the Roku app as a remote.

Very easy to install with my 55" TCL. The sounds is a HUGE step up from TV speakers. I read about people having problem with the volume. I did not have this problem. It was also powerful enough to scare my dog a little at first when I was playing Doom. I live in a 1,500 sqft house, and this is fills the entire house with sound when the volume is at 60/100 - even when I'm using power tools.My wife and I both love the Bluetooth connectivity, and the Bluetooth button makes switching inputs very quick and easy. It was very easy to mount this to the wall. I installed a bypass outlet to run cords behind the wall, so you see any cords running to the TV. This fits beautifully right under my TV.

The Alto 7+ is an amazing value at less than $200.  It was so easy to set up and the sound was terrific, especially considering the cost.  The cables were included (typically you are forced to buy in addition to the soundbar) and the wall mounting kit made it quick and easy..even for me!  The fact that I can control with my existing  TCL remote is also very beneficial in my house which already includes far too many remotes!  Oh and my kids love how easy it is to connect to their tablets to listen to their music via the easy to connect Bluetooth functionality.  Overall GREAT Soundbar.

I have a TCL w/Roku TV in my RV that is about a year old.  The built-in speakers sound like tin cans on strings, so I wanted something a little better.  This Alto 7+ 2.1 soundbar & subwoofer fills the bill perfectly.  My RV has a telescoping TV lift built into one of the cabinets so I was able to mount this soundbar directly under the TV on the lift mechanism after adding my own home-made crossbar.  Fits and works perfectly!  The wireless subwoofer is hidden behind the reclining theater seats on the opposite wall.  What more could I possibly ask for?  It gives FAR BETTER sound quality than the stock TV speakers, but let's get real here:  It's still only a 2.1 speaker system so it's not up to true theatrical sound quality.  But still, for $149 bucks it's a HUGE improvement and a great deal.  Oh, and a couple days after I paid $149 they dropped the price to $129.  Go figure.  I'm tempted to return it for a refund and buy it right back for $20 less, but I'm too lazy to dismount it and box it up.As for the remote control that some people seem to complain about, the Roku TV remote powers both the TV and the soundbar On/Off, and it controls the volume as well.  The ONLY thing I need to use the Alto 7+ remote for is to switch the EQ setting between Movie-Music-News.  In truth, I'll leave it on Movie for everything because I think music sounds fine on that setting too, and I don't care about the news.

Don’t believe the negative reviews. This thing sounds great. You’ll see a lot of reviews where people complain that they have to turn it all the way up to hear anything. They clearly didn’t hook it up properly. The instructions are very clear and show you what settings to use depending on the way you hook it up. This soundbar sounds great. It’s very clear and crisp and the bass from the sub is just as clean. The IR remote pass through works flawlessly. If you have a WiFi based remote, you may lose a little functionality. The unit comes with a HDMI cable you can use if your television has a HDMI ARC port. It also comes with a digital optical cable (my method of connecting) and an aux cable which probably isn’t the best method. Like I said, it sounds great, was easy to hookup and it’s as simple as plugging the bar and sub into an outlet and connecting the input of your choosing.

Save your money. This is cheap. And this biggest issue is that STUPID 15 minute shut off. You cannot change that so if you are playing or controlling your TV in another room, and need to pause, you can't turn it back on without going back to the room. In today's day and age where things are controlled by apps and phones, this is stupid. And the sound is cheap with little options. No added bass, or reduction. Limited equalizer options.

Owned for several months now.  I mounted it directly to the wall in my kitchen under my cabinet and I use it to connect Alexa so she can finally have some power!  (Yes, in my kitchen. Why not?)  Don't trust the provided drill hole template, mine was off by about 3/4 of a mile.  The Echo dot sits right on top of the speaker and connects via aux cord.  But Alas, this was a fail.  The speaker powers off automatically after a few minutes of idleness.  So if I want to ask Alexa spontaneous dumb questions or play music, I have to turn the speaker on every time.  It ruins the moment and makes me look dumb (but that's not hard to do).  "D" for not doing my homework (my wife sarcastically said: "Nice job Mark")  But the price is reasonable for the value of the speaker.  The bluetooth seems to connect well, my kids like to connect their phone and play their weird music, my laptop on the table connects to it to play sound.The grill is not fabric, and looks sharp. The all black color is stealthy, all Darth Vader-ish. The color coded label on top helped me learn the LED colors on the front of the speaker:  for example, blue light for bluetooth connection, or green light for auxiliary audio in, etc).  So you can see what it's set to at a glance.  I am somewhat disappointed with the low end frequency sounds, like bass guitars, and the thump of a bass drum or snare, these are lacking and I wish I would have purchased a system with a wireless dedicated bass. Seems to drive the best sound over bluetooth if I turn the volume on my phone to max, then control volume strictly from speaker.  Also lacks clarity with the high frequency sounds like crash symbols, violins, guitar solos, and the pluck of acoustic guitar strings. No equalizer that I'm aware of so I can adjust it.  There are however, three presets, but I only ever use "Movie" -  even for just listening to news because the other two are simply more hollow and fall flat (but maybe that's your thing... weirdo).  The volume range is excellent, plenty of power. I wouldn't use this system for my home theater unless it's connected to a receiver that lets you adjust highs and lows, and yes, get the version with the dedicated bass.

I bought this to replace my old 2.0 Vizio soundbar that was five or six years old. The speakers from my old Vizio sounded slightly better (more highs and clearer), but the bass from the TCL subwoofer is more punchy. This might be because the speakers on the Vizio are slightly bigger. The whole Vizio unit is almost twice as tall as this unit. I ended up keeping the system because if you get the Alto 7+ and connect it to your TCL TV through the HDMI ARC port, you can control the TV and soundbar through the original TCL Roku remote. But be sure that the IR receiver of the TV is visible to the remote because you cannot mute the soundbar unless it is. Otherwise you can control the volume up/down through the soundbar directly.I  gave this 4 out of 5 stars because I wish it was a more more detailed than my old system and had actual EQ settings like treble and bass.

I own a TCL 6 series tv and it fits perfectly under that tv. It's has HDMI arc and is easy to use. Sound quality is okay. I am used to home theatre speakers so I think I am biased against sound bars in general.  I think it's better than tv speakers.

The TCL Alto 7+ sounds really good using Bluetooth. The sound shakes my house. On the other hand, there is almost no sound coming out of it until I reach volume level 70 or above like other users have said. Turning it up to volume 100 is still not loud. I went through troubleshooting with TCL support and everything is hooked up correctly. I tried using both THE HDMI ARC and optical cable on my  75" TCL's, and it made no difference. I also have a 55" TCL TV and I hooked it up, and it sounded the way I would expect a sound bar to sound. The bigger TV is brand new, so I would expect the soundbar to integrate better with it.*** Update ***
Jumped on this right at launch to see how it could work in replacement of an Onkyo 5.1 system I'm not effectively using.Warning!! I am not an audiophile, just the common man.

This would be perfect, but the product description is inaccurate, so I got burned.  The device claims to be controllable by the Roku TV remote that comes with Roku TV’s sold by TCL.  However, there is a large caveat that is not disclosed in the description.  It will only work with the infrared remote that comes with the Roku TV.  If your TCL Roku TV comes with a voice remote, it will NOT control the soundbar.  I confirmed this with TCL customer support after calling them to see why my remote would not work. Note that TCL’s website and user guide do not disclose this issue.  You will only find out if you call their customer support for help.

All my settings on the TV were correct Sound bar does not give sound until you hit 70% and even then you’re better off with your TV speakers because the sound you want doesn’t come out until you max out the speakers at 100% very disappointed after calling TCL the only troubleshooting method  was to unplug everything and hold the power button for 15 seconds which is meaningless Do not purchase this sound bar!

For the money, this is one of the most impressive buys I have ever made. It's great for watching movies, shows, etc but also awesome for listening to music ... really great for gaming also. Get one you will not be disappointed. I got the larger one (7+) with the subwoofer. Love it.

I bought my TCL Alto 7.2.0 sound bar to pair via HDMI ARC with my TCL 55R617 TV - this seems to be a popular bundle on Amazon. Unfortunately it suffers from a serious flaw.The minor flaws are somewhat 'muddy' sound, with lower-pitched dialog being very hard to hear, a volume control that adjusts painfully slowly between silent and slightly loud, and a flaw which means that if your TV/sound bar combo isn't switched off manually but sleeps due to inactivity, the sound bar won't wake up and has to be unplugged to power it off.

I purchased this soundbar because it was advertised that I would be able to control it with the TCL Roku TV remote but that hasn't happened. The TV remote does not control it at all.If anybody knows how to control it (on/off and volume), please let me know. I have asked customer support but they haven't helped yet. I will update this review at a later time...

Interesting enough this does not fit under a TCL TV.  If you don't have a C8 series, you can put in in front or in back of the TV.  I have a C8 series and it looked off in front of the TV.  I guess most might mount the TV on the wall, we choose not too.Sound is really good.  I had a hard time connecting the sub at 1st, but I did the steps for manual connection and it worked.  Easy operation, I recommend using the HDMI-ARC option on your TV, my TCL TV's HDMI 3 has the ARC setup.

UPDATE - DAY 2 - PART 2:After some digging around, it turns out that buried on TCL's site, there is a firmware update (v0.1.2, which isn't reassuring) for the soundbar. The changelog states that it adds the ability to disable the damned auto-standby (attached screenshot). I guess we'll give it a shot! Still not sure if I'm keeping or returning this, tho.

I had an expert install the sound bar.  If you want to do it yourself, you will need knowledge on how these things work. I bought a new TV from the same manufacturer. One would think it would install with no problems. However, the installation person could not get the sound come on automatically when my TV was turned on, I opened a case with TLC. They sent me a new remote which was as dead as a door-nail. They then informed me that the remote for my TV is not compatible with the sound bar. They offered to send me a remote that is more basic but I refused as I did not know if this remote would be really helpful in running my TV. The reason for the compatibility issue is that I bought the 2018 model and the sound bar is probably the 2019 model.

I can't believe the same company made my TV made this sound bar. Works when it wants to, kicking in and out. Works with some apps, not others (how?) sometimes stays through a whole DVD. The remote is great if you want a chunk of plastic to hold down paper, but does not actually operate any electronics....except for when you've hit volume down and nothing has happened and suddenly five minutes later it rolls down to nothingness. If I had not accidentally thrown away the box, it would be going back to Amazon. I may still give it to someone I hate.

I got rid of cable almost ten years ago and have been a strictly stream kind of guy. I purchased a 60' TCL Roku Television, I wasn't impressed with the audio, it was OK but a little flat EQ wise and the built in enhancements didn't help much. I purchased this sound bar, after reading some reviews, watching some Youtube unboxings, which were mixed but I decided to go with it. I'm not sure who these people are who review products but for me this thing is very  nice for the price. Here's what I can say, I won't go through all the specs because even though I could, none of that really matters in my opinion, it's the sound quality.1.For me, I have a relatively small one bedroom apartment, decent size.  I have a 4K Firestick, PS4 that's basically it. After installation, it took a little adjusting but once I did that, I immediately could hear the difference. An important thing to note. These days, audio and video is coming from so many different sources, Youtube, Netflix, if you're still doing the cable thing... the important thing to know is this is only going to sound as good as your source output. That means if you're watching some video on Youtube or an old DVD movie, don't expect this to blow you away with sound because it all depends on how the audio source was encoded, bottom line some things will sound better than others, it's not the speakers fault necessarily.  When I plugged in the PS4 and tested it out with a few games, it was immediately clear how much better the audio was. Explosions, SFX and BGM were resounding and filled with rumbling low tones and bright high to midrange  panning from left to right. The EQ only has three presets MOVIE, NEWS and MUSIC, I set it to MOVIE which sounds the best to me, the subwoofer really thumps on this setting.

I got this on Prime Day as a package deal with a matching 55" TCL television. A major influence for me (besides the price) was the Bluetooth connectivity so I could reduce wires on my wall-mounted TV. After trying for hours to get the BT to work, I contacted TCL customer support which was difficult for me because I'm a male. After a long and difficult-to-understand conversation (don't you dare call me racist, I just had difficulty understanding with the accent and poor connection) with support, I was informed the BT doesn't work with the TV, it's intended only for connecting with mobile devices. Really? Really?In addition to the lack of BT connectivity, and I'm being honest here, the audio from the soundbar isn't any better or louder or deeper or higher than the speakers in the TV itself. I would not recommend this product to anyone unless you want a rather large mobile speaker for your smartphone. The TCL TV itself is wonderful though. Don't know how they missed the mark so bad on the sound bar.

I, like many others, have the typical cheap 50-ish inch 4K TCL TV. I purchased this as a cheap means to upgrade the audio. I'll be blunt - this is significantly worse than the built in audio on that TV, and frankly worse than most other TV's built in audio.The bluetooth connectivity is neat, and ARC is nice to have, but it just sounds so bad. It can be loud, sure, but at the end of the day everything sounds muddy and compressed.

For the price, this is a decent little sound bar.  It offers pretty good sound and even has a surprisingly reasonable level of bass despite not being paired with a subwoofer.  My biggest complaint is that the volume seems to jump from just a tad too quiet to a tad too loud.  The loud parts of movies get too loud, quickly, so I turn it down a bit and then when it gets back to dialogue, I have to adjust it back up.  I can't seem to find a happy medium.  Also, it only seems to want to turn on with the remote for the speaker, the TV remote doesn't turn it on (it's a TCL TV).If I had to do it again, I'd get something that a) had better sound control, b) had HDMI input that would allow the TV to power it on and c) get one with a subwoofer.  Like I said, it does have a surprising amount of bass but more low end would be nicer.

I bought this sound bar because I own a TCL TV and I didn’t want to add another remote. I wasn’t looking for dramatic room-filling surround sound for movies, rather, maybe just some enhanced sound and more clarity, as I suffer from deficient hearing. This sound bar delivers neither. I have a Bose Solo 5 on another TV that does have better sound and a button for speech that actually works. The TCL sound bar reminds me of the sound you used to get when they used to build real speakers into the TV set. The only positive is that the sound bar and TV operate with the same remote and both start up concurrently.

Product came without wall mount hardware, power cord, connection cables - appears to have been a previous return that no one checked prior to sending back out!Be careful with this Amazon seller - also the return shipping was not prepaid and It cost me $14 to return it. Not a happy customer!

I purchased the TCL Alto 7+ 2.1 Channel Home Theater Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer - TS7010, 36", Black to add sound to my 50in 4k display. Its connected via optical. All my music, video and game audio goes through this sound bar. There are a lot of sound bar choices, many are expensive. You dont have to spend a lot to experience awesome sound with this sound bar. You may not know TCL brand but they make decent electronics. I am pleased with it as it sounds incredibly rich and crisp. The wireless sub adds enough deep dynamic bass to feel it. It comes complete with the necessary wiring and wall mount hardware.

TCL describes this as their top of the line 2.1 soundbar. But I disagree. This thing sounds as empty as the Sonos Beam. Which is not as good as most people think either.Pros: Easy setup, okay sound, ability to update firmware via USB.

Added this sound bar to my TCL-TV. The TV's speakers needed help and this did the trick.  I have not used the blue tooth so I am not judging that.  I will say that the sound bar does work with my TV remote but does not engage the on screen display.  I cannot choose my own sound settings, just 3 programmed choices: news, movies, music. Okay for me but probably not for someone who wants  premium sound.  But it works well for the price and set-up was easy.  I do wish the unit wasn't so long. As you see in the picture, I use  a stand and this sound bar is too big to put on the lower shelf. I knew that when I purchased it. However, I live in an apartment, and did not plan on mounting it on the wall.  I thought I could put the TV on top, but it is rounded, but It works fine in front of the TV, just be aware it's not optimal this way.  And the instructions recommend not to obstruct the area around the sound bar.  FYI

I love everything about this woofer sound bar combo, i had absolutely no issues connecting it to my TCL 40S325 TV literally plug and play over the included HDMI cable using the ARC input on my sound bar and TV. The woofer paired instantly. I love listening to music on it. DISCLAIMER: I bought the 7.2.1 model and i am not an audiophile however the sound was much better than my TV. My TV remote entirely replaced my sound bar remote seamlessly. You will need to go into options and disable your TV's speakers to make full use of the sound bar. I've heard your woofer placement doesn't really matter as they are multi-directional unlike tweeters.

We purchased this sound bar to use on our patio and pool area. Our iTunes via Bluetooth or a movie on the TCL TV we purchased with the bar sounds incredible. We can crank the volume up and hear clean crisp sound anywhere around our patio and pool. Easy set up and looks good.We chose this bar to use with a TCL 49 inch TV, permanently mounted outdoors under our porch. The quality exceeds the price and we are happy with our new entertainment system. In order to protect our system from dampness, damage, and theft we also purchased a Storm Cell. We’d recommend anyone considering an installation like this to purchase one of these. Heavy duty plastic that encases your equipment, mounts to the wall, weather resistant, lockable.

I have a tight 36"W x 24"H x 12"D shelf above my refrigerator where I mounted my soundbar with a 40" TV above.  These fit perfectly.  I originally purchased the Alto 7 2.0 soundbar with internal subwoofer, but I was disappointed by the wimpy sound of the bass from the 2.0.  Sound quality is important to me as I frequently listen to music in my kitchen.  I returned/exchanged for the Alto 7+2.1 that I'm extremely happy with.  The sound is fantastic and fills my kitchen with full-spectrum sound.  The only improvement I wish was available is the ability to adjust the bass/treble, but it's not essential as the sound quality is very good.I was even able to hide the subwoofer behind the TV on the shelf.  Setup was incredibly simple.  Subwoofer pairs automatically to the soundbar and the volume is controlled automatically by the TV through the HDMI/ARC - I don't even need to use the soundbar remote control at all.  Occasionally I connect directly to the soundbar via bluetooth.

I got this to replace my vizio sound bar that mounted below the tv with these small drop down arms then screw bolt into hole. This speaker does not use the standard threaded bolt hole instead it uses a plastic key hole shaped hanger like you find on a pre-made shelf. These can break and warp over time since they are plastic, but a strong ABS at least. Does not go into standby when the TCL TV goes into standby but rather a few hours later. The speaker can be awaken by pushing the volume up key on the TV roku remote. Honestly if I knew it used keyhole mounts I would not have bought and seriously considered sending back till I engineered a solution using wing nuts and rubber washers.

I wish I would have read the reviews instead of just trusting the star rating. I bought this soundbar specifically to pair with my TCL Roku TV because I was having a hard time getting another soundbar that I purchased to connect to it. This "soundbar" is not a soundbar. The sound volume is worse than the TV itself. The sound goes from 1-100. Normal sound in a small livingroom starts around 60. If I'm washing dishes or something that adds to background noise, I have to turn it up to 90. But even 90 isn't crazy loud. 100 isn't crazy loud. I bought a soundbar to give more gravity to the programs and movies I'm watching, but I feel that this device takes away from that. It's the same quality as the speaker built into the TV, but the soundbar is quiter! Definitely returning!

I'm really happy with the Alto 7 because it has an HDMI connection- once I set up the soundbar (an extremely easy process), I was able to adjust the volume with my Roku TV remote. The sound is also great.One thing to note is that, at least with the TV I have (43" TCL 4K Roku TV), if you don't/can't mount either your TV or the soundbar, the soundbar (when sitting in front of the TV) is tall enough that it covers the signal receiver on the TV and you would only be to change the channels by holding the remote up at an angle. I solved this by propping up both legs of the TV with books so that it rises above the soundbar.

A major disappointment. Be warned that this device, when paired with your TCL TV, will only work with the TV, but none of the apps on your TV. No Pandora or music apps; no YouTube; etc. So it’s use is quite limited, and the sound with the TV wasn’t all that special. I made 3 separate calls to TCL support, yet were unable to improve the sound or get any audio with music or video apps. Sending it back, but let the buyer beware on this one...

I bought this soundbar when it first came out for TCL Roku TV compatibility, so I wouldn't have to worry about using a second remote. There was a vague implication (product description was less accurate at the time) that it was compatible with the roku remote, which it is not. TCL's biggest selling point over other budget TVs is integrated Roku, so one would expect full integration with the remote. Since the soundbar blocks the TV's IR receiver when placed on the same horizontal surface, I have gone back to using the TV's built-in speakers. The 7-model soundbar is too long for the surface I have my 49" TCL 5-series TV on, so I'm without any viable pass-through options. I have the Roku speakers for my larger living/family room TV, but I'd rather not pay their premium price (premium at my budget) for my smaller bedroom TV that is in a more cramped space.

I purchased this because my TCL tv speakers for some reason weren't as loud as they use to be. Turns out I just needed to move my tv and they got louder. Which I figured out after I ordered this 😆 Any who, item arrived on time with pretty fast shipping, about 4 days. It was bigger than I excepted for the price tag of around $135 after tax. Hook up was super simple and came with all cords to hook up all the different ways. I use the optic cord and it sounds great. Easy settings in my tv to get it connected to the speaker. Now the Bluetooth. This thing is incredible!! I was completely impressed. That subwoofer hits pretty damn hard and the speaker gets almost too loud 🤣 and I LOVE loud music. I find the Bluetooth is significantly louder than the optic setting for sound. But I don't want my movies as loud as my music anyways. Just as good, if not better than the $300 systems some of my friends have. My TCL tv remote controls the unit as well. Only thing I don't like is there are only 3 preset settings to choose from for sound. Other than that, I highly recommend checking this out. You won't be disappointed. I know I wasn't.

The lady i spoke with sounded like she was gargling with marbles and trying to sing at the same time.  She asked me to punch the black button on the sound bar remote--every button is black.  Not much impact.  I asked to speak to a supervisor.  I am almost 35 min on hold.  My TCL TV is fine.  I bought the upgrade TCL sound bar, which so far is a huge mistake.  Buy someone else's product.  It looks like i will return it.  You would be shocked at the amount of time i have spent on hold and trying to make this work.  My wife is boxing it up for me to save me that aggravation.  Lousy product unless you like extra remotes.

This brand new soundbar won't even turn on. Tried multiple outlets just in case - will NOT power on. After spending time to unbox and connect all cables, etc. What a huge waste of time. Have never experienced such poor quality in an electronic product. Maybe because I've never bought TCL before. Returning to Amazon and certainly won't buy anything from this company ever again. Buyer beware - find a legit company to buy from, not TCL. (Btw, TCL customer service is closed on weekends - fitting.)

I purchased this sound bar to go with my new ROKU TCL TV. I like it because my ROKU remote controls the sound as well as the TV via the HDMI ARC. The sound is very good for a 2 channel set up. The soundbar remote will let not let you change fine tune the bass or treble, but there are settings for music, movies and news.  Music sounds good and the dialog in the movie mode is clear. All in all I am happy with this purchase.

This was offered at a reduced price with the matching Smart TV; impulse purchase.  It works; occasionally loses the connection, an easy re-do, but this does not provide the stereo sound or the range of sound you might be looking for.  The Subwoofer provides a very quiet bass; if it's lost connection, you might not notice.  It certainly does not provide the "feel" you'd expect in an action scene.  I look forward to seeing if it will allow the addition of two more Bluetooth speakers, but I am not holding out hope and will probably replace it with a multi-speaker, theater system.

2 units later and both have been returned. For the short period it plays and works it's exactly what we needed. But then the audio just randomly shuts off while the unit is still powered on. You can turn everything off/back on or unplug etc and it may or may not immediately start playing sound again. But if it does, it just turns off the audio again shortly after. It can't sit and watch tv without spending most of your time screwing around to keep the audio playing. What's the point?? Both have been processed for return (first one did this, did exchange and now 2nd one is doing this).

Unless you want to keep up with a credit card size remote, choose another sound bar! The sound is good for the price but the remote is horrible!!! I should have read the reviews first. I can't believe a brand like TCL in the year 2020 is not capable of creating a remote/soundbar that can be used with a universal remote. Now I have to keep up with this itty bitty remote or keep walking over to the bar itself. Shameful in 2020. Again, the sound is good and very loud but without a remote, it's just blah. I would not recommend or buy a TCL product again.

I have a 55-inch TCL TV in my bedroom and wanted to upgrade the sound out of the TV set. The TCL Alto 5+ 2.1 channel soundbar and subwoofer more than did that. I get a rich sound with a decent amount of bass from the system. I believe that the performance of the system provides a great value compared to the cost. An additional benefit is that I can control the volume using my original TCL remote. The only downside is that you can not see the increase/decrease in volume anywhere for the soundbar. Overall, I give this a solid four out of five stars.

Works with TCL TV so I don’t have to use separate remote control for volume. Good sound for the price .Balance the TV volume and sound bar volume. Sound bar will only get to a certain volume based on the TV.  Adjust sound bar to almost maximum then use tv remote for up down volume control. Tv volume and sound bar volume increase or decrease at different rates. So keep in mind the number displayed on tv isn’t always relevant to actual volume, just a reference for up or down .

I have a 65 inch TCL series 5 from 2018.  This paired simply with the TV and the sound is great.  Great for the price.  I did take off one star because the sound bar does not fit underneath the TV.  Given that it is made for TCL TV's I find this crazy.  It's about 1/2 inch too tall to be actually under the TV.  I have it directly behind the TV, with the top of the bar pressed up against the back of the TV.  Not a big deal at all, but triggers my OCD.

I bought this to pair with my 65 in TCL 6 series TV. I wanted a simple upgrade to the tv speakers and this bar and woofer delivered. Super easy to wall-mount under the TV for a clean look. Also, it works seamlessly with the TV remote, so I'm still living off one little beautiful remote.I would agree with other reviewers that you have to have the volume up higher than you'd expect. I dont see it as problem. I play mine anywhere between 40 and 60. I cant imagine ever wanting it higher than 75. The thing gets LOUD.

This sound bar offers a decent clear sound, better than my 55” Samsung TV speakers which annoyingly rattle and vibrate at higher volume.  No real bass on this sound bar so if you need the bass, get the subwoofer.  Only thing I don’t like is my Roku Streaming Stick+ remote will no longer control volume and I have to use the tiny sound bar remote to adjust volume, then go back to Roku remote for all other functions.  Not sure I gained much as multiple remotes is not what I was looking for.  Low marks for remote capabilities.  I’ll use the sound bar until I get a new TV at some point.

Sounds okay, perhaps not incredibly better than the regular tv without the sound bar, but no complaints there. And I could live with the fact that it only starts with the tv 50% of the time. But it has a VERY short sleep function and no way to disable it. So if you want to pause for a few minutes to grab a snack or get the mail, be prepared to dig out your sound bar remote to restart the thing. Wish I’d known before purchase.

It’s no secret that TCL’s tv sound is lousy. To boot, my 2 year old Roku 45” tv’s audio started having a (commonly reported) garbled, underwater sound.  Turning off the volume leveling corrected that. (The video also intermittently disappears, but that’s a whole other (known) issue.Enter the TCL sound bar. When you connect the sound bar, you turn off the tv speakers which removes the tv sound mode and leveling options. So now I can hear the tv program at an almost preferred level - the volume increments could use improvement - but the commercials are way too loud. (Maybe 1-2 volume clicks higher - Isn’t there a law against this, FCC?) Netflix and Hulu were also erratic, but not nearly as bad as cable.

I would recommend this soundbar if you are looking for good quality for a low price. Replacing a Klipsch R10b that got fried by lightning. Not as good quality of sound but also not near as expensive as the Klipsch.Install was easy good instructions and came with everything I needed.
Hooked this up to my new tcl 65".  I'm noticing much of an electronics guy, but installation was done in about an hour.This was my first sound bar, so I cannot compare to anything else.

Not the greatest but definitely packs a pretty good punch for the money. It sounded better than the Bose 5 sound bar we had. Fuller range of frequencies as well. Only issue is that the unit doesn’t control from our directv remote except for volume. It turns on when we push the volume up on the directv remote when we only want the tv volume to turn up.Issue: the audio is delayed from the video. I know this because when the tv volume is on alongside this sound bar, it is well behind the tv sound. Like a bad echo of about 1/2 second. It’s almost unusable. Sound effects are behind and conversations almost feel like an old Karate film with voice overs.
Beyond expectations!  I would say this may outperform others as a budget solution that delivers deep, rich, truly non-distorted sound.

WARNING! Do not buy the sound bar. I had very little expectations and just wanted something to make a small improvement from my TV speakers. This actually sounds worse than my TV speakers. They advertise it is 2.6 inches deep. What they don’t tell you are the brackets and power cord add another inch and a half in depth. This means that looks bulky and sticks way off the wall.So not only does it sound bad, it looks ugly and was completely deceiving but it’s advertised dimensions.

I love this! My TV is huge, but had poor sound. I feel like I’m in a movie theater now! I purchased this for the HDMI connections, but I didn’t realize the HDMI was for a Roku TV. I ended up using the optical connection, and that was perfect! I tried to syncing this with my Fire TV remote. It does work, but you’ll need to use the sound bar remote to turn it on and navigate your connection (optical, AUX,etc), but it works to control the volume the Fire Stick. Easy peezy! Happy girl.

I bought this. I opened it and it was damaged already. Chipped remote, and the screws holding the sub together already was falling apart. I called customer service and was able to get a $15 off discount if i kept it. Well i guess 2 months later the sub just stopped working. I contacted TCL support and they were pretty much useless.There is no reason to have a soundbar without sub. The sub makes the soundbar. Save your money and get something else .

We bought a 65 inch TCL 6 series TV and also bought this TCL sound bar. It greatly enhances your viewing experience with solid sound and a sub woofer that does the low end job as well. The sound fills our den just fine. The price is a big selling point as well. Don't hesitate to buy this. I am an audiophile for decades and I find no fault in this system. I come from the surround sound home theater heyday and a sound bar with wireless sub woofer work perfectly. Two thumbs up. 👍👍

The lows were so bad that I thought the subwoofer wasn’t connected. I tried the different modes but none of them were good. They all sounded barely better than the bad tv speakers and worse than my first gen Amazon Echo. I couldn’t find any way to adjust the sound other than the presets. I ended up replacing it with a Vizio SB3621n that sounds much better.The one thing the TCL does better than the Vizio is the TCL has an hdmi in that lets it connect smartly to the tv. It turns on and off automatically and the tv volume buttons control the sound bar. For the vizio I have to leave it on all the time and use a universal remotes that sends the volume buttons to the sound bar.

Ordered the TCL Alto5 for living room tv and it sounds great. Just enough base and it enhances your tv volume to sound crisper and with great base a great clarity. Set up was not hard but had to provide one of the cords myself (audio in/out cord) because the one provided did not work on my tv. Functions are great and straight forward on the soundbar and the remote. Only drawback is the remote is tiny (2 inches long 1.5 inches wide). I can see this tiny remote being lost very quickly. Over all a great product for $49. Strongly recommend buying.

Bought a TCL 6 Series 55" and thought the 7.1 TCL soundbar would be a great way to go.  So far, the sound is decent BUT I cannot get the picture abd sound to sync. The sound is a fraction behind the picture.  Tried changing to optical cable connection but no help.  TCL Support has been no help.  Since they are somewhere in Asia, if your issue does not fall into one of their scripted answers they do not know what to do. Their are no A/V Sync settings on either the TV or the sound bar. Fortunately I'm still within my return period!!!

I bought because I have a tcl tv that has horrible sound. It does work well with the factory remote and the sounds is much better. The shocking thing is the volume. It seems much less than the factory speakers. I rarely used more than 50% before and now they do sound better and I can understand the dialogue but the volume is 50-100%It's just kind of shocking that an upgraded sound system with so many boxes doesn't correlate to an increased volume capability. In fact it's worse.

This this was terrible!!! Even right out of the box the sound bar was barely louder than my actual tv. When it worked, the sub woofer was awesome! I like the nice sleek design . The sound is pure quality. Tried my phone as well with the Bluetooth and I’m very pleased, the sound in terms of loudness and audio quality is amazing.

Looked all over for reasonably priced sound bar finaly found his one which happens to be our tv brand. We ordered two one for living room and one for man cave, great sound and price was reasonable. I would definitely buy from them again.  You will not be disappointed with this product.

Soundbars range from $50 to thousands of dollars. So this is in the low end dollar wise. With that said, this soundbar is pretty good. Very simple to use, connected to my roku tv instantly (via hdmi) and we can control volume using my roku remote. It connect to my phone via bluetooth without issue.Sound is pretty good and I think this is sufficient for people that are looking to enhance their sound a bit and add volume. If you are looking to get Bose quality sound then this isn't for you. Comes with 3 preset equalizer settings: news, movie, music- small difference with each setting. It's designed to be simple and it is.

I bought this to pair with a JVC 43" smart 4K TV who's speakers left much to be desired, As I have this in a bedroom I didn't really need the sub woofer so the 7.0 version was perfect. Wall mounting was simple and the HDMI ARC made for an instant connection to the TV. I would like to see more user adjustment than the 3 presets but that is quibbling for a sub $80 speaker. Sound is clear and room filling and while not surround sound the design does give much more presence than the built in ones. Having the option to pair with  a Bluetooth headset for night viewing while not disturbing others is a nice bonus

Has HDMI Arc, so you don't have to turn it on and off, just works with your normal operation.  Thin TV's today don't have room for adequate speakers, so going from TV audio to any soundbar is going to be a huge improvement.  Of course there are systems out there that will sound better, but also probably cost 3 times the price.  To me this was a great purchase, and would recommend it to anyone buying a soundbar that doesn't want to drop $500.  Works flawlessly with Samsung 65".

Bought this sound bar as an add-on to the TCL 75" Roku TV I just bought... thinking that it would be a no brainer to hook up and should work fine with the TV without having to use a separate remote for the volume.  Well, it hooks up via the optical cable just fine, but it turns out that if you don't use the HDMI ARC port, you won't be able to mute the volume via the TV remote, you will need to use the sound bar remote.  (Maybe you don't, but I use the mute button a lot.)  I read about this beforehand on these Amazon reviews, so I was expecting this.  What I wasn't expecting is that this soundbar doesn't come with an HDMI ARC port.  Seriously?  Considering that answer about needing to use the HDMI ARC port came from TCL, they might have mentioned that it wasn't an option at all.Anyways, in the short time I used this, the sound was pretty good for what you would expect from this type of setup.  The wireless bass seemed to work good and sound decent too.  But no mute function via the normal TV remote, even though you can adjust the volume, has me returning this as soon as possible.

Worst $130 I’ve ever spent my money on. You know, initially, this product worked really well. I wasn’t too familiar with soundbars and subwoofers prior to purchasing it. I went as far as finding audio tests on YouTube to see what I was working with. It was awesome, it sounded like I was at a movie theater! However, later that night, my girlfriend and I watched a movie on Netflix. I noticed every time there is dialogue only, the soundbar is accompanied by a very noticeable high-pitched noise. It’s as if the soundbar is good for one time use only. Not to mention, the subwoofer would get “confused.” What I mean by that is it couldn’t distinguish the appropriate time to activate. For example, there would be a scene with dialogue only. No music, none of that. However, the subwoofer thought it was supposed to be in use and would give off a “farting” noise (that’s the best way to describe it). I was very upset in this purchase. I’m looking to send this crap back, because it’s honestly a joke. You’re better off investing in something that is $70 more and I guarantee you won’t run into these problems. The best part about this product was the remote 😂. Pathetic!

This is a great sound bar for the price, sound wise. We use it in a smallish room and it fills it well. Particularly because the TCL TV's internal speakers are not the greatest. My biggest gripe is that this doesn't work with the Roku Voice (RF) remote. Worked fine with the IR Roku remote that came with the TV, but I upgraded that remote to an RF one because it was truly terrible (you had to figure out the exact spot to point it at on the TV, and it took multiple button pushes to get any reaction from the TV). Anyway, the RF remote works great with the TV, but come to find out does control the volume on this sound bar. So now I have to use the sound bar's remote to control the sound bar volume. This is not clearly disclosed anywhere, as others have said. It's a real bummer for an otherwise good product.

Does exactly what it says. I bought a TCL 50 inch Roku TV in April 2020 and my sound bar wasnt compatible with the TV remote. I bought this to use with the Roku TV's HDMI ARC capabilities so I could control the sound bar with the Roku remote. It was super easy to set up. It recognized the sound bar automatically. All I had to do was go into the menu and turn off the TV speakers. Volume up, down, and mute all work flawlessly. Pretty loud, loud enough for most rooms I would think. Sounds good. If you're looking for top of the line sound you shouldn't be looking at less than 100 dollar sound bars anyway. If you have a TCL Roku TV this is a no brainer. I would think this sound bar would be sufficient for 90 percent of the people who are thinking about buying it seriously enough to have read this entire review.

Coming from base tv stero sound, these things are night and day different. Sound is Soo much crisper and deep, I believe has to do with the fact they are forward facing nd the subwoofer is where ever you put it. I am still experimenting on where the best place to put the subwoofer would be. Base is deafening and for an average open livingroom I can't see why you'd more than this. I ran almost to full power and I could hear the music from the 1st floor to the 3rd floor. They get loud...maybe not rave party loud but base is def there. For the price there is almost no risk. You can't go wrong w this unit.

Not bad for it's price. Has it's drawbacks (no sub level adjustment, minimal EQ adjustment). BUT, for a HDMI ARC hook up with a wireless subwoofer at this price point I am happy. The sub is a bit lacking and (as mentioned) has no adjustment. Soundbar is decent, loud but lacking range. Connectivity was simple and BT is a nice addition. Nice size at 36".Another plus or minus, depending on your situation...The soundbar wall mounts with plastic keyhole connections at the back. Nice for a wall mount but if you want to VESA mount w/ a bracket you'll need to find your own hardware that fits that narrow keyhole.

Sounds pretty good even when too loud.The DVR remote is on the same wavelength as this remote control so changing Channels, viewing recordings or FF/RW the volume goes up or down with every button push.
I got a new 65" TCL Roku TV for the holidays and wanted a soundbar for it.I did some research and went with this brand since it is TCL and uses HDMI ARC connection.

it arrived in a comically large box that contained the box that contained the sound bar and subwoofer.  After reading the directions 2x(my habit after a very expensive lesson learned the hard way) it took about 10 min to set up. Put batteries in the remote, place things where you want them, plug in one HDMI, 2 power cords, check TV settings  and party on...It sounds really good for what it is. This does not provide an immersive experience like the full 7.1 system I got rid of but I knew that going in and it's a perfect way to improve on tv speakers while keeping the look neat and footprint minimal. This is my first soundbar and I'm pleased.

Not the greatest soundbar. Received it free with my tv on a lightning deal, so that is the only reason I have not returned it. The sound quality is hardly better than the tv itself. The built in "bass" is hardly noticable. I am comparing this to the more expensive model we use in the living room, but I would honestly expect it to be louder than the TV it came with.

Bought this for tcl 4K tv. Sound without it is terrible and low. I absolutely hate having multiple remotes. This speaker and subwoofer is great- if you have an hdmi arc port on your tv it will come on automatically and you can use your normal remote for volume control. Not the most amazing speaker- I have a Sony tv and subwoofer in another room and it is better, but this is great for what we need it for.

It arrived well protected in only two days.  Setup took less than ten minutes (mostly changing the TV settings).  I strongly suggest only using the TV HDMI(ARC) connection for good audio quality and easy use.  That way the TV's volume control and mute functions affect the soundbar and you can leave the soundbar's remote in the drawer.  Although the TV optical output produces great sound, for some crazy reason the TV optical output is not affected by the volume control and mute.  Therefore you have to use the soundbar's remote for those functions. Stick with HDMI(ARC).  Overall, I'd give this product a solid "A"

This is my first sound bar purchase, so I don't have much to compare it to. But from my limited knowledge, I am happy with the quality of this sound bar. It was pretty easy to get set up using the provided optical cords, and the sound itself is nice. If you want more bass / lower register, you'll probably want a sub-woofer, but for my needs (living in an apartment), it's perfect. I'd buy it again.
Wall mounted below 49” TCL Roku.Used the HDMI/ARC cable supplied. Piece of cake to get it going. Note: Users guide TV set-up differs slightly from Manufactures Installation video.

The TCL Soundbar does not fully integrate with the TCL Series 4 Roku.  I was very disappointed that the mute button does not work  nor does the volume come on immediately.  Other wise it is not a bad soundbar.

I've had this item for a couple months now. I found it fairly easy to connect and use. This sound bar makes the TV sound a lot better, and louder.I did not have to configure anything, the sound bar connects to the TV via hdmi and it will turn itself on when the tv turns on, same when TV turns off, sound bar turns itself off.

Admittadely I have only been using this for about an hour. I got this to replace an old speaker not a soundbar. In my search for a proper soundbar for my room, I researched far and wide and I decided to take a chance with this soundbar. It's one of the cheapest options that comes with a subwoofer. Very easy to understand LED light color system to identify inputs. The subwoofer is wireless, so you can place it anywhere in the room! Overall, a great purchase.

The internal speakers of my TV sounded better.  Bass is non-existent and the audio sounds like it is being played through a pringles can.  I thought the 4k+ positive reviews indicated this was a great cheap soundbar that supported ARC.  Honestly, I can't accept that sound quality at any price.  Sent it back.

This is decent for the price. The sound bar sound is really good, the sub though... ughhh not so much. I honestly have no idea why some people are having problems with this product. I wish they could get a replacement or something because this is amazing soundbar. For my decent sized living right next to a busy street, the sound clarity and volume is awesome. I didn't buy a subwoofer though. But even without, it manages bass just fine. It also works with my firestick via bluetooth so I don't need extra remotes or cables. It's only been a month but I have been extremely satisfied with it.

Sounds great, way better than tv speakers. Had to put the tv on like 40 before we could hear with ac on before. Much better now, but can’t see the vol level anymore, but whatever. All good now!

1st shipment without sub, replacement shipment without sub,....speaker without sub sold out. Hard to compare to an already reallocated surround sound system, but not do I miss it now. Only works with 3mm cable, not HDMI. I took the discount and regret it. Looking elsewhere.

Price was equal to that of a Samsung bar and wireless sub, but tried it anyway. The device worked just fine when setup correctly. Recently purchased the Alto 7+ and hooked is up to my TCL 6-Series, setup was a breeze and the soundbar contained the mounting kit and every cord I could possible need. The sound is crisp and clear no matter how loud I have the volume, even the sub hits shockingly well for how much I paid for it.

My TV did not have great sound so I looked for a sound bar to improve it. This sound bar does give out much better sound than the default TV system. It does improve music quite a bit and I like that it has three programmed functions because I really don't want to fool around too much with something like this.  I like that it has multiple cords for setup as well, I used the AUX cord and will keep the other two if I ever upgrade my TV.

I got this soundbar because I lost the remote of my previous Amazonbasics soundbar. let me get the cons out of the waynone

Sound bars add so much value to the TV viewing experience. I honestly cannot imagine watching one of my favorite movies without a quality soundbar.
