Bought for my son's room & he really likes it. Setup is fairly easy, although we had some issues with Bluetooth connectivity. It took four tries but eventually it picked up his phone, a Galaxy S10. Considering the price point & the purpose it's a good buy.

Sound bar seems to work ok.  Subwoofer doesn't have the boom I expected & no way to adjust it.  Also, the thing flutters when the tv is off.  Nothing like being woken up in the middle of the night with a subwoofer loudly fluttering for no reason!  I keep the damn thing unplugged most of the time.  I should of done more research.
This sound bar would not power on. New out of the box tried both power cords. Could not get the led indicator to come on. Returned.

Despite some of the reviews on Amazon and YouTube - I think this system provides the enhanced audio experience of a tv. Using this with a TVL 4K 32” tv and was much better than most cheaper sound bars. Sound is good in any direction but best when directly in don’t of it. TL;DR sound is great and easy to use, ARC control is broken, need to use included remote to wake from sleepPaired with a TCL TV. Unit was easy to setup and controls are simple  when it works (my setup is auto-on and volume control over ARC.) Sounds a lot better than I thought it would be. The subwoofer is not all that boomy, but it's perfect for my bedroom where this is employed with a TCL Roku TV.

This provides really good sound for the price.  It's 4 bar speakers do very well, but the sperate base speaker is just 'ok'.  And there is no volume control for it. The two are not compatible.  So, I have to control the volume through the TCL remote, only.  I talked with both Vizio and TCL soundbar, and that's the fact. I bought this to upgrade the sound on a tv I bought for my office, hoping to replace a couple of small old desktop speakers with it.  While better than the tv audio, its not by much. Instructions were not clear on exactly which cable to use and show connecting all cables when the best option is just using the HDMI Arc cable. The unit is about an inch too tall to fit below/under my 65" TCL Roku TV. I made wooden blocks to elevate the TV. It does sound good.

Two things. There is no tone control with this device so you can't sharpen it. On the other hand, it has a lot of good base notes for smaller speakers. I love the fact that the TV remote takes over for the sound bar once it's set up. Great sound for movies and most music. It's a sound bar so your not going to get floor shaking bass but it does ok for it's size.

I bought this to mount infont of my bed to listen to music and the sound quality is not good for music. I have not tested this speaker for movies or tv or anything other than music. At Low volume, my TV sound the same as the soundbar, The Movie bottom sound better bass than the Music bottom, no Bass or Tremble bottoms to control. Bought this sound bar for my TCL 6-series TV. Have had this for a few weeks now and am very happy with it. I've never had a soundbar before so keep that in mind, but I'm impressed with the sound I am getting with this. It was brand new wrapped up in  plastic in the box but it had several surface scratches on one end. am sure it came from the manufacture like this. no big deal for me tho  since I  placed it in a speaker shelf on a tv console. Was not just a plug and play as advertised.  Had to call customer support multiple times to get the sound bar to sync with the smart tv. The soundbar is better than TV speakers. For the price, that's great, but I would expect more from a system that ships with a subwoofer. It takes up space, adds zero bass, and has no adjustments available.

While I'm more experienced with tons of wires and and down firing sub, I just moved and cash is tight. This came as a bundle with a 50" TV.. why not!?I think it's perfect for my 1BR apt. The sound is clean. The bass, however, won't shake any floors. You really have to look for it to feel it. However, it does it's job at sensible volumes.
Not bad, it could use a little bit more bass,

I bought this for my daughters room, the room is 12' * 24'. I told her to turn it on and watch a movie to see how it would work. I was working on my car and had to go back inside and tell her to turn it down the neighbors could hear it. for the moment it is great. e will see how long it survives a 13 year old and her friends. 07-15-20

We purchased a TCL Roku TV about a year ago. We recently purchased a TCL sound bar and are attempting to connect the sound bar which needs HDMI arc and our DIRECTV cable box which also needs HDMI Arc. We thought it would be simple To hook up a TCL sound bar to a TCL TV. However our experience has not gone well. I’ve looked through all the questions and answers and none of them seem to address this particular issue. It has been very eye-opening As this should have been an easy setup.

I had no issues connecting it to my TCL TV via optical cable. TV remote still controls volume. Only negatives are 1) Loss of OSD for volume. Not sure if that is really something I can fault the sound bar for. 2) Lack of even basic audio controls like bass/trebel. It can be quite boomy and makes it difficult to watch TV at night without disturbing the house.
Great bass and sound for the price.I hate that it turns itself on when you change channels or media.

Using this system with my TCL 55” 4K HDR tv apps the sound is low and has to be set at 60 or above to hear it.. but through my Amazon fire box the sound is as a sound bar should be! The set up is stupid compared to other bars, this thing has to use both optical and hdmi cord instead of just your optical cord like other systems. I haven’t tried with my Xbox one yet so I’ll update this review once I experience that!
This is exactly what I needed for my TCL since the speakers in the tv are a bit small.  I think it has 3 additional speakers in the sound bar and it works perfectly for my room configuration.
For a simple system, this fits the bill and works great.

This seems to be a good investment. Was easily installed. Came with everything you need to hook it up and even mount it on the wall. I followed the quick install guide and it automatically connectedto my TCL tv's remote so I can adjust the volume using it. The quality of the sound is great. So far so good...

This bar had absolutely no bass at all, sounded terrible. Also had it connected via HDMI Arc and it did not work properly. Returned it and got the Polk sound bar with subwoofer for a little more money and way happier.

I read lots of bad reviews on this, but mine works and sounds fantastic. I`ve  got it paired with a TCL 43 in. tv, With ARC HDMI, on both, Maybe that helps, I just followed the set up instructions and it sounds awesome streaming classic rock videos off of YT out buy the pool.  This is the TCL  alto 7  2.0  built in subwoofer.

Instantly synced with my the TCL tv I purchased it with. The sound bar volume was controllable from the TCL Roku remote, which is awesome. I've had negative experiences with LG not having this feature. Down with multiple remotes!It sounds loud and great for the price. I recommend this sound bar if you are looking for a deal that won't disappoint.

Not a bad sound bar, but lacks any real volume. Thee is no level balancing as was promised by TCL in a firmware update so the volume is all over the place.  I have a 65” TCL TV. It works great with ARC, bit the volume has to be turned up to 70% before the bar can be heard and dialogue is sub par.

Just hooked up my soundbar and subwoofer to my HDTV and I gotta say, it was easy and simple. The only downside is there is no way to adjust EQ levels but besides that, I'm very impressed. The sound is AMAZING compared to the TV speakers. Bluetooth pairing is simple and music is VERY LOUD!! Took 5 minutes to install and start listening which was great, power cable and optical cable were all I needed. For the price, I'm very happy with my purchase. More than enough sound for my apartment.

For the price of just $129 you're getting a pretty amazing deal with both the soundbar and the sub. While if you're goimg for a full home theater K would say go for something a lot more expensive. I have this just in my room because the speakers on my Tv isn't great. For small to medium rooms this thing is great as while the bass won't shake the whole room you can still feel its presence. If you also have a Tcl tv you're able to connect it via hdmi ark and make the whole process super simple.

You get what you pay for but obviously it should still be functional within a year of purchase.  Within 6 months the left side of the bar started crackling.  Many trouble shooting options from various consumers talk about easy fixes for this problem.  After exhausting all of them, attempting different measures to make sure proper "out audio" settings were aligned with the the various apps I use, effectively I'm left with the same issues.  Which probably means the wiring inside is shoddy, came loose and will now forever put out subpar sound.  Save yourself the frustration and trouble and don't be persuaded by the cheap package deal, upgrade and pay the price.  Just my two cents.

I purchased this because it said it had some bass or at least "built in subwoofer".  It really wasn't any better than the TCL series 5 speakers built into the TV.  It connects nicely to the TCL and I thought that being of the same brand it would be an improvement.  Not so.  I returned.  Misrepresentation.
The instruction booklet is tiny and completely incomplete. I had to google like five things to try and get it to work.I've been at it an hour and it still is not working correctly.

This soundbar is the perfect companion for my TCL Roku TV. I was genuinely surprised to find that there was no setup involved beyond plugging it in. I plugged it in to my HDMI ARC port and it just worked. My TV remote controlled the sound immediately, and the soundbar turns on and off with the TV. You really don't get much better than that! Oh, and it sounds great too!
I bought this to have better sound, especially looking for improved dialog, and found it worse than the built in speakers....disappointing

I wasn't really expecting much bass from this set up, but I didn't expect 0 bass.  The woofer barely vibrates in the most intense, bass heavy scenes from movies and music.  I have an old $50 Insignia 2.1 soundbar/subwoofer that I played side by side with the Alto 7+ and that made me pull the plug and return this.  To be fair mids and highs are clean and loud, especially in Movie mode.  That means if you are buying this for the soundbar, it is great - maybe just buy the 2.0 set up and save $20.  The subwoofer does nothing, sorry to say.
Great little sound bar for cheap bought it with a TCL TV 55 inch 4K which is a great buy  also

Unfortunately, there is a half second lag between the sound and the picture. So I have to return it. I'm connected to a brand new Samsung Series 7 50" tv with the HDMI arc cable and can' make this sync up. Since you have to be connected with HDMIarc for the tV remote to control everything, this is going to be a return.

I bought this for my 2019 TCL TV since it was by the same manufacturer.  The integration is excellent when using an HDMI cable hooked up to the TV’s ARC HDMI input.  Once connected there is no need to use the sound bar’s remote as the TCL TV remote will control the sound volume and turn it off.  The sound quality is decent and definitely a step up over the TV speakers.

I purchased this one since we have a TCL Roku tv.  We wanted the original tv remote to be able to work with this soundbar.  This works just as it should.  However, during a normal show we have to have the soundbar turned up well over 60 to be able to hear it from our couch and recliner.  And on some "soft" shows, it's not uncommon for us to have the volume turned up close to all the way.  So, no idea how long this will last since it has to be turned up so loud all the time.

We hooked this sound bar up and are very happy with it. It comes on automatically when the tv comes on. Even though there’s a subwoofer there isn’t to much base which is good when you watching normal tv but I wish it had more for when we are watching movies. Sound quality is clear and very good. Easy to hook up.

So where to start. The good - the unit has great crisp high and mid audio. The bad - there is little to no bass unless you crank the volume and even then it is only slightly present.I even went through the trouble of putting this in a corner to amplify the little bass it did have. Ultimately this is im a bed room so lack of bass when watching movies at night isn't a complete deal breaker, but there are much better performing sound bars at this price point. This is one of the few times an Amazon favorite/recommendation has let me down.

I bought this unit to set up an outdoor theater on a budget and I will say right off that I think it was well worth the money for that purpose.  Both the sound bar and the subwoofer  require 110v power but only the soundbar requires an audio cable. The bluetooth connection to the subwoofer is automatic if you connect the soundbar before powering up the sub.  This is by no means an audiophile unit, but if you want more fidelity and clarity than your TV speakers can deliver ( and certainly more than the 1" speakers in my projector) then this is a good place to start.Please note!  My outdoor theater is completely portable .. NONE of the components are waterproof.

Sound is better with the sound bar. Disappointed this TCL sound bar does not seamlessly work with TCL ROKU tv it was paired with on Amazon. Using the TCL sound bar brakes the TCL ROKU tv remote’s mute button, forcing the use of two remotes (TCL ROKU tv remote, and TCL sound bar remote).The noise level often jumps from a bit too low, to too loud when using either remote to increase the volume.

I have to say this is a good budget sound bar. I love the TCL brand. The sound is crisp and install is easy. I wish there was a way to adjust the EQ instead of only having a few presets on the remote. Also the bass from the subwoofer is close to nonexistent. I wasn't expecting much from a lower priced sound bar, but I think these could be improved upon even at this price point. Having said that, this unit is worth the money to upgrade from your built in TV speakers that muffles dialogue and directs sound into the wall. I will most likely move this to the bedroom and upgrade to a better unit in the living room.

Ordered this TCL and Sony sound bars to compare, and found the TCL audio to be crisp, clear and the subwoofer is more than adequate for my condo living room. The BIG plus for the TCL is the ease of operation. With the Sony some buttons had to be pressed, and some had to be pressed and held - very confusing and difficult to remember! Another plus is the TCL was half the price of Sony...

I bought this for the price point AND not really knowing much about sound bars.  The sound is decent, but the volume control is inconsistent, the mute doesn't work and there isn't any visual to show the sound level.  Not sure if this is common, but it takes about 30 seconds for it to come on (if it does at all), when I turn on the tv.  Many times I have to physically turn it on because the remote isn't working.  Returning and trying another level up.

It works well, particularly at the price point. I despise it shutting off if there's no sound after a few minutes, and the repeated shifting to another type of input not used after re-powering it. But the sound is good, and I like the features. Under a 43" TCL TV, it is a bit over an inch narrower than the TV sides. This combination makes for a nice and compact package and good value.

I’m really trying hard to love this product. The sound however is disappointing. Whenever there is a “loud” scene during watching it cracks and is obviously less than quality audio. Not sure what to do to fix this but it’s concerning that it’s been installed and this issues correctly occurs.Also, the remote is ridiculously small and dainty.

For the most part the sounds bar had good sound quality. Unfortunately one of the speakers or something is rattling when the bass hits. I also noticed when I connected my phone and played music on Spotify the sounds was really tin can sounding. I’m going to exchange this sound bar for another one and  see if I have better luck.

Got this soundbar for my dad who has trouble hearing. We are both very happy and satisfied with this. All the cables you need are in the box. The built in subwoofer is a huge plus. The sound is loud and crisp. It easily connects to Bluetooth and the TV. I will admit it did take a little bit connecting the TV remote to the soundbar but it did pair up and it makes it easier to use just one remote for both tv and soundbar. If you are looking for great sound with great volume look no further its right here. Definitely will buy again money well spent.

There are a lot of reviews here saying that this sound bar is no better than TV speakers.. possibly even worse. Those reviews are correct. These are basically cheap tv quality speakers placed inside a sound bar. I tried all the connections.. HDMI arc, optical, and 3.5mm and they were all awful.I'm not joking when I say that my $30 PC speaker system that I bought at Meijer outperforms this sound bar.

The first one got lost in the mail and they sent me a second one. When it finally arrived I hooked it up and it played fine. I’ve had it for a couple months now and it works just the same. I like how the volume control is only by the phone. You don’t have to turn up the speaker and your phone. For the price and the features, I recommend.
This thing sounds better than those costing 3-4 times it's price. So well in fact I purchased a second. Works flawlessly on HDMI ARC with both TCL r625 and Samsung.

I need another soundbar for other tv and will not purchase this one.It keeps losing signal and I have to unplug each time because it freezes and I cannot do a thing thru remote or the buttons on the bar itself.

This is the first bad review I’ve ever written. Sound is ok but using the speaker with other remotes, even the tv remote makes it unusable. It won’t work with any remotes except TCL remotes and it won’t work with most of them. It was a waste of time and money. I have been very pleased with TCL up until now. The worst part is that I bought the speaker and the TV together from Amazon and the remotes won’t work together. Unbelievable!!

Functions of the sound bar work great. But about every 3-5 times you turn it off. It won’t come back on. You will have to unplug it, leave it off for a few seconds then turn back on. Gets annoying. Keeping sound bar since only using in sun room not a primary use. Arc does work with our LG tv. And roku stick programmed to it just fine. But the power issue leaves me with doubts.
Pros:-Cheap

Sounds nice the one I got has the sub woofer. And it’s plenty enough loud to shake my house. For the people that gave it s bad review. Somehow your not doing something right. Use the optical connections if you have it. My Tcl tv remote controls the volume Super easy to get working

This sound bar was a huge disappointment. It sounded tinny and my internal TV speakers sounded better. Then there’s the annoying function that requires you to scroll through all the different settings/colored lights every time you turn it on. That was a real nuisance. Had to return this after the audio output started to become intermittent.

This soundbar has very good quality sound.  Nice highs and channel separation.  The Bluetooth subwoofer handles the low end adequately as well.  I installed on the top of a TCL 55" Class 6-Series 4K 55R625 using the recommended Mounting Dream bracket.  I had much better luck with an HDMI (ARC) connection rather than an optical cable.  Both cables are included, but the optical cable is rather cheap and I had an issue with picture and sound in sync.  No such problem with HDMI.  Plus, if you go with HDMI (ARC) you can use the Roku remote to control sound on the TCL 4K TV.

I recently purchased a TCL 65 QLED and along with it this TCL soundbar.  The hook up was super smooth and it all technically works. However, the subwoofer, despite a variety of placements and settings is almost non-existent, unless of course you turn up the overall system volume to some ridiculous level. I pretended it was OK for a week or two but finally decided to return it. I replaced with a Yamaha YAS 209BL, which is admittedly twice the price - but it was WELL worth it. Better sound, independent subwoofer controls and tons of headroom in the bass department. Bottom line, if you're going to get a new big screen TV don't skimp on the sound.

Setup was easy, and took about five minutes using the optical cable connection to my television. I’m not really an audiophile, but the sound is great for what I needed. I’m using it in a reasonably small bedroom, but it feels like it would be loud enough for a larger room or living room area. I really liked that the sub unit is wireless. If I had any complaint, it might be that you have to press the volume up and down more than I would have expected to change the volume, but it's barely even worth mentioning.

This product surpassed my expectations, it was easy to setup and connect to my TV. With a few easy steps I easily got everything up and running within 10 minutes from unboxing the product. My TV sits in a built-in cabinet with the speakers on the back so the sound just bounces around. With the TCL sound bar and subwoofer connected, I know have amazing sound that makes me feel like I am in the action which makes for a much better viewing experience. Great product and would buy again!

I bought a 55" led tv and the sound was horrible. It was quite up close and when you walk in the other room it would sound loud.This soundbar is exactly what I was looking for. It's not audiophile quality but it works great for the price. My movie watching enjoyment increased substantially.

Tcl 5 series speakers sound better. Sound bar sounds muffled or bass orientated, dialogue is very bad. When changing the volume it randomly goes in increments of 2,3,4 hard to set at a certain volume. Music and News EQ settings sound exactly the same, Movie EQ seems to bump overall sound up. Might sound better on a higher end tv. Worth $50 tops

Do not buy. Volume projects very low and can not be altered. Delay between picture and sound which is frustrating when watching tv. Often does not project sound and requires tv be shut off and turned back on.  Bass sounds muffled.  Company refused return after 30 days. Buy a better brand.

Very good sound, including the bass from the subwoofer.  Was disappointed  for my fault not reading the description in full, as the model 5, I ASSumed it was a surround sound with two rear speakers as well.Otherwise, it does sound great for a 2.1 system.

Excellent device. Very impressed with the package contents, mounting brackets with screws, optical and 3.5mm audio cable and a wall mount guide.  Super easy to install. Connects great with the Apple TV.  We hung it above our bed post for a more immersive viewing experience. For the price, the Alto 5 is a steal.
Missing second power cord that was supposed to be included. Had to use one of my own. Pretty heavy on the mid. Wish it had more control on EQ. Other than that it's a pretty good sound bar.Update:

Our TV didn't seem to have the volume coming out the front but back towards the wall. We had to turn the volume way up to hear what the actors were saying. This TCL sound bar is great it puts the sound forward and we can turn the volume way down. Great Price too
I get tired of all the sound coming out of the back of the TV. I thought a more directional speaker would help.It didn't.
Investing in this soundbar is highly recommended! Sound clarity is excellent. Watching movies or TV with it is a whole new experience!

I purchased because I had bought the 65inch TCL qled TV. I worried as many reviews stated it had connection issues and that's the main reason I kept like brand. Hooked up with HDMI, ARC on TV, and it took me messing around about 20 min to get connected. I honestly don't think I did anything magical, I think it finally connected. It worked great with no connection issues until I changed out for a longer HDMI cable. Had same issue, but again, it connected and has worked now for the past month with no issues. Not super loud, but clear and works for my intention.

I ordered this speaker because the speakers that are in the TCL tv sucks. It was easy to set up and trust me when I say easy I mean easy. I now can keep my volume on my tv at a 23 instead of 35-40 to hear it. I am very satisfied with this purchase. No issues at this time.

Sound quality is great but wasn't quite enough boom for me, they are good quality & works great easy to install, I would recommend them, you can't buy anything better for the price. What I'm looking for, I have to spend more

It came with a variety of cable choices to connect to various types of ports on the Roku TV. It does not come with an ARC/CEC connector, however. I'm thrilled with the sound using the optical connection since I love to listen to music via my streaming TV services.
I purchased this TCL sound bar to go with my TCL TV In my bedroom. It’s perfect for a small room and amplifies the sound.

I read some other reviews and was somewhat hesitant. I am glad that I purchased this soundbar. It gets really loud and is still very clear. It is a great value. For $60 it sounds and looks like it should have cost $150. I am very happy with this purchase.

Set up was super easy and functioned pretty well with our Roku TV. You'd expect that, being made by the same company. What I should have also expected was sub-par sound from a company that specializes in making okay TVs. The sound just wasn't great. Bass was muddy and there was some crackle and distortion in the high end that made me miss the TV's speakers. So I returned it, gave $60 extra to a company that actually specializes in audio, and now have vastly improved sound.

The Samsung Smart TV speakers started cracking so I chose to go with a sound bar from Amazon rather than buy a new TV, however if it wasn't for U Tube I would never have figured out how to set it up because the directions left out how to bypass the TV speakers and get the output to the sound bar. This is not a plug and play operation.

This product is great for the money the sound quality is much better than the television.  The bass is awesome it literally shakes my dishes in the kitchen cabinet when music is playing. The only problem is my TV remote is now only controlling the soundbar for powering on and off ot doesn't control my TV power anymore. Still trying to figure out this problem.

I added this sound bar to my recently purchased 65" TCL tv.  I feel like I'm at a theatre when I watch movies.  The sound is very clear. Sometimes it even scares my pets!  Live streaming music sounds great!The only negative is that my cable box remote changes the volume when performing other tasks.  For example, while scrolling through the guide the page up & down button not only advances the page but it also changes the volume in increments of two (2).

Remote is very strange I hateIt, but most sound bars have horrible remotes, on the other hand the sound I’m amazed especially for the price and the brand I didn’t know much about, but I’m pleasantly surprised. Minimal cords because the subwoofer is blue tooth was also amazing.

I bought a TCL TV, and this was a recommended accessory. I thought, "Meh! What the hell...," and bought one of these speaker systems. Glad I did! It took longer to get the TV and speakers out of the boxes than it did to get everything up and running.

I guess I should have known I wouldn’t be blown away with a $120 sound bar. It’s underwhelming. When purchasing a sound bar I expect to have the sound be crystal clear and need a minimum amount of volume to get a real movie theatre feel. I still have to go to a pretty high volume while watching movies. It’s ok. If you want movie theatre I’d spend the extra money.

Item was purchased on the 12th of June. Hooked it up in the garage for a Bluetooth speaker while I workout. Monday July 27th it began cutting out frequently. Wednesday July 29th it works for roughly 5 minutes before dropping audio completely.Have owned several TCl TVS but this was a major disappointment.

You will not get blown away by the sound.  This is a entry level system.  With that said its really good sound for the price.  Volume seems to be a bit low for how high to have to set it but everyone knows that.  It's way better than down firing TV speakers.
It adds a little more depth to the sound, it's been really nice to watch movies and have a little extra sound play a factor in our experience.

This speaker goes great with my Roku 50in TV. Extremely easy to hook up and the sound quality is absolutely superb. The remote control while small works like a charm. I’d recommend this speaker to anybody looking to make their TV just a little more entertaining when it comes to sound quality!

This was great - until it stopped working. TCL customer service isn't very good. They don't listen and they don't have answers. I paid to install this and it was a dud. Still don't know if they'll get a new one and install it. Total waste of money. Terrible product
Works great, easy to setup and sounds very good. Wish it had more features but for the price it's a good device.

I have two of these sound bars, one for the bedroom and one for the living room.  Each one has the same issues.  Each one is hooked up to a TCL tv and you have to have the volume up almost to its limit to hear anything.  When you try to switch from one streaming channel to another (i.e. Hulu to Netflix), the sound bar loses connection and you have to turn the tv completely off for several minutes and then turn it on to the streaming channel you want.  And that doesn’t always work.  You’d think since the tv and sound bar are made by the same company, they’d work better together.  Definitely not worth the headache.

Not bad for the money. Sound is pretty good quality. The only thing I do not like is the remote. I can't be more than a few feet away from the Alta 5 to use the remote. If it wasn't for the cheap remote I would have given it more stars.
Love this new Soundbar with sub!My TV is slim and sexy but the audio, was not amazing. I added this soundbar with wireless sub and was astounded by how great it is!

This unit works perfectly with my TCL TV. Setup was as simple as plugging in the HDMI cable, placing the sub woofer, and powering on the TV and sound bar. A few easy steps through the TV's menu and the soundbar was fully connected and working.

You're honestly better off just using the TV speakers. They are no better than the built in TV speakers on my TCL TV. Infact with the sound bar I actually have to have the volume almost all the way up while with the TV speakers I can clearly hear things as a much lower volume level.

Nice speaker but I don’t like the fact that it Hass to be plugged up in order to work the Bluetooth is Soso it’s nice just not what I want I would like something that doesn’t have to be plugged up to an outlet in order to work

Sound quality is fine good even but no way to adjust bass like with a crossover and does not get very loud if your thinking to use for movie night or music I would look at other options. Not bad quality but I would not purchase again

I probably spent more money than I wanted to but it was worth it. This soundbar works flawlessly with my TCL tv and I like the fact I can still use my TCL roku remote to control the soundbar and do not need two remotes. The sound quality is excellent and comparable too much more expensive soundbars. In the future I will be purchasing another TCL.

Sounds great for the price. Works great with my TLC TV. Kids are constantly telling me it's too loud cause I can't hear well so I turn it up full blast. They can hear it throughout the house even with their doors closed.

Super easy setup and excellent sound quality given the budget price. Everything sounds crisp, and the sub makes a huge difference. If you're looking for an upgrade to your TVs built-in speakers, this is probably the best choice out there for <$200. One downside is there are only 3 preset equalizer settings available, but they get the job done.
Picked this up on Amazon day as part of a TCL TV package.  Great buy.  Easy to set up right out of the box, easy to use Remote.  Awesome sound.

This is a great sound bar/sub combo, and I’d highly recommend it for the price and value. It turns out apartment into a fantastic movie/gaming hub and paired fantastically with our new TCL 5 series 55”.Regarding all the reviews that complain about the TV sound interfering with the speaker, they just didn’t read the instructions on their sound bar or look at their settings menu. You can set your Tv to only play through the sound bar and sub, at least with my TCL series 5. So there is no problem there.

I liked the ease of setup and all the cables were included.  The confusing part was having to turn down the TV volume to zero  or having a weird time delay in the audio.  Overall very satisfied with my purchase and would definitely recommend these speakers to anyone looking for a good soundbar/subwoofer combo.Wishlist:  I would have liked to see a way to hookup an external set of speakers to the soundbar.  I have wired rear speakers in my living room that I wound up taking down.

I use this with my TCL TV, and I love how it sounds when I stream movies and music.  I am not an Audio teckie so I can't give you any of that information. I just know it my TV sounds better using the Alto 7.

Excellent sound and simple setup- cordless sub-woofer works flawlessly.  Only complaint is that it is advertised  to work with the TCL TV remote- it doesn't with mine. Good product for far less than most of the comparable systems.

Goes with the tcl tv. As soon as I connected arc hdmi automatic sound. Nic3 bass. I use in a bedroom so huge sound isn’t needed. Just something better than tv speakers on flat TVs. Great price for the value. If u don’t need the sub the bar is awesome. But the sub adds depth to movie watching and since home is the new theater, good time to have good sound quality. 4 stars because obviously higher priced items would sound better but for its category 5 stars.

Purchased this sound system to pair with my Roku TV.  The sound is crystal clear, and loud enough to drown out my neighbor's Harley!! It has bluetooth feature that I absolutely love, I can use my phone to play my favorite spotify playlists (sadly Roku has a pandora app, and no option to add spotify).  The design is wonderfully inconspicuous, and now my living room is extra fancy!

This is a pretty nice sound bar.  Sounds great, but there is no EQ for bass just 3 presets.  It is quite small, I was expecting it to be much bigger as I opted for the Alto 7 but the 65” TV dwarfs it.

Remote impossible to use with TCL television. Volume controls add unnecessary problems with controlling the bar and tv independently. Bar often prevents signal from reaching tv and refuses to turn off/on even with IR passthrough. Garbage.

Waaay better than expected!  Not just “for the money” like many reviews say, but the best sound I’ve had from a TV ever!  (That said, I’ve never owned one of those $1,000+ systems...). I use the “Pass Through” audio setting on my TCL TV.  I don’t know if matching the TV and sound bar brand contributes to the high audio quality, but worth noting.

I was not impressed with the sound quality of this soundbar. The high rage was lacking and very little bass from the sub. Was connected via optical to a TCL TV. My 10 year old $100 Visio soundbar sounded much better.

I ordered this to compliment my 65"  ROKU TCI  tv purchase. The TV only sounded OK at best but this sound bar really woke things up! I have  several thousand dollars in home theater equipment but it's nice to just use a sound bar for general TV viewing and this more than does the job!

Installed for my father in law because he was constantly screwing up a far better but more complicated sound system. I had to create a fools proof system, which this system accomplished, so he could continue to watch TV with sound.

Im thoroughly impressed with this sound bar for the price and quality of the sound bar, remote, bass, and above all the clarity of the sound. The only thing I wish they would of integrated is the compatibility for both the TCL TV and TCL sound bar remote to interwork together. Works great with TCL 43 inch 4k bedroom TV.  At 36 inches wide, its about exactly the width of the TV itself.  Wall mounting was easy as were the connections, 1 hdmi cable to HDMI1(ARC) on the tv and power.  For the price, I'm quite pleased with the sound and experience.  The sound quality is a good step up from the built in speakers and most importantly it doesn't require a separate remote or any additional steps to use it.  Just turn on the TV and the soundbar turns itself on, adjust the volume or mute with the TV remote and that's what happens.  Turn off the TV and the soundbar automatically goes to sleep.  No extra steps, just works.  I didn't bother with bluetooth, the included remote, spdif, or other sound sources as I didn't need or want those functions.Very minor quirks:  the volume scale is very different than the TV.  A volume of 60-65 with the soundbar is equivalent to 30-35 from the TV before.  Still gets far louder at 100% than i would ever need for a bedroom TV.  Next, the roku TV, on the home screen, always shows a selectable channel for the HDMI1(ARC) input.  If I try to remove this from the home screen it disables the input and then ARC doesn't function, which is how the soundbar gets the audio signal from the TV.  I put it at the end of the list and ignore it, it doesn't hurt anything for it to be there other than to be a visual distraction.

TCL makes great TV's, in some cases really excellent TV's. The same cannot be said about the TCL Alto 7+ 2.1 Soundbar with subwoofer. The audio sounds muddy and in some cases crackles. The audio adjustments (bass, treble, loudness) are non existent and instead are limited to pre-configured audio settings for music, movie, and news. I ran the device through various genres of music and found the lacking subwoofer control to be frustrating. Im all for thumping bass, but the mix needs to be just right so it compliments the audio, not drown it out. Lastly, the volume buttons are squishy and the volume change appears to have delay to it, which means it can be slightly tricky to get the volume to the level you desire.On the positive side the subwoofer automatically paired to the soundbar, the ARC input worked great, Bluetooth, USB, AUX, and optical all worked well too. The lacking LCD screen means you are stuck with a decal on top of the soundbar that shows a color code that coordinates to the input you have selected. Its less than an elegant solution, and TCL should consider a small low resolution screen on the device, or include connectivity to a mobile app for more granular control.
